contextId.quote: threw dust into the air and upon his own head

contextId.information: "he has shook his fist against God." This is a sign of aggression. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: he has reached out with his hand against God

contextId.information: Clapping the hands is a way of mocking someone. Here it represents the wind making loud noises. AT: "It makes loud noises like someone clapping his hands to mock him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: It claps its hands at him in mockery

contextId.information: This was a sign of respect. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
contextId.quote: The princes used to refrain from talking when I came
